questions.questionText: What is the primary function of the CPU in a computer?
questions.optionB: To execute instructions and perform calculations
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is the brain of the computer that executes instructions and performs calculations.

questions.questionText: Select all components that are part of a computer's RAM:
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: RAM includes memory modules and cache memory. Hard disk drives and SSDs are storage devices, not part of RAM. Full marks only if both A and C are selected.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are programming paradigms?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: Object-Oriented, Functional, and Procedural are programming paradigms. Dynamic Programming is an algorithm optimization technique, not a paradigm.

questions.questionText: What is the time complexity of binary search?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: Binary search has a time complexity of O(log n) because it divides the search space in half with each comparison.

questions.questionText: Select all relational database management systems:
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: MySQL, PostgreSQL, and Oracle Database are relational databases. MongoDB is a NoSQL document-oriented database.

questions.questionText: What does the HTTP GET method do?
questions.optionB: Sends data to the server for processing
questions.optionD: Updates existing data on the server
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: The GET method is used to retrieve data from the server. It's a safe method that shouldn't modify server state.

questions.questionText: Select all that are JavaScript frameworks for front-end development:
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: React, Vue.js, and Angular are front-end frameworks. Express.js is a Node.js backend framework for building server-side applications.

questions.questionText: Which sorting algorithm has the best average-case time complexity?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: Both Merge Sort and Quick Sort have O(n log n) average-case time complexity. Bubble and Selection Sort have O(n²) complexity. Both B and C must be selected for full marks.
